intro: Lychnis flos-cuculi, commonly known as the cuckoo flower, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its striking pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are tubular at the base and flare out into five petals, often with a distinctive red or purple spot at the base. Lychnis flos-cuculi is often found in moist meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
